items.summary: The Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) has urged the government to prioritize investments for sustained economic growth, recommending a 12% increase in central capital expenditure and a 10% rise in state capex for FY27.

items.title: Bombay High Court rules in favour of AB InBev in trademark case
items.summary: The court ruled that using the "COX 5001" trademark amounts to "passing off", a term used in intellectual property rights (IPR) law referring to making a false representation that is likely to mislead someone into believing that the goods or services come from another source.

items.title: Tata Capital anchors Rs 2,300-crore refinancing of Jayaswal Neco debt
items.summary: The refinancing was anchored by Tata Capital with a commitment of about ₹800 crore, alongside Investec at ₹300 crore. Other lenders and investors in the syndicate include Vivriti Capital (₹200 crore), Hero FinCorp, Hero Corp, DSP, Oxyzo and a clutch of family offices, taking the total deal size to around ₹2,300 crore.

items.title: Regulatory hurdles likely to delay rollout of satcom internet services
items.summary: So far, Starlink, Eutelsat OneWeb, and Jio Satellite have completed most of the licensing and space-regulatory steps, including obtaining the Global Mobile Personal Communication by Satellite (GMPCS) licence, and approvals from space-regulatory body In-SPACe. Commercial launch, however, hinges on the spectrum allocation based on pricing rules, and compliance with security and capacity rules.

items.title: India-Oman trade pact likely to be announced during PM's visit this week
items.summary: India and Oman are poised to sign a Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA) during Prime Minister Modi's visit, aiming to significantly deepen economic ties and open a new chapter in bilateral trade. The agreement is expected to boost trade and investment diversification, building on existing hydrocarbon cooperation and exploring new avenues in green energy.

items.title: Fresh push to unlock Mumbai’s long-stalled Pagdi buildings redevelopment
items.summary: The country’s financial capital has over 19,000 pagdi buildings, with more than 13,000 still pending redevelopment, many in prime central areas where land is scarce. The move is expected to generate renewed investor interest and potential development opportunities across these high-value precincts.

items.title: New Education Bill to replace UGC, AICTE with regulatory council; Centre to hold more power
items.summary: Marking a major shift, the Centre will also ensure that the new regulator is divested of all funding/grant mechanisms, which will instead be handled by the Union education ministry.

items.title: Airports Authority's high-frequency radar to be relocated, will unlock land for affordable housing in Dahisar: Union Min Rammohan Naidu
items.summary: Mumbai's Dahisar radar will move to Gorai. This unlocks hundreds of acres for affordable housing. The decision follows a meeting with the Civil Aviation Ministry and Maharashtra government. Cabinet approval is sought for early construction. This move will allow redevelopment of old buildings.

items.title: Andhra tops fruit, fish output; posts steady growth: RBI report
items.summary: Andhra Pradesh has achieved top national rankings in fruit and fish production, alongside robust economic growth with a GSDP nearing Rs 16 lakh crore. The state also shows improved per capita income and a life expectancy of 70 years, aligning with the national average. These achievements highlight significant economic and social progress.

items.title: Andhra Pradesh becomes India’s top fruit, fish producer amid steady economic growth: RBI report
items.summary: Andhra Pradesh’s GSDP estimated at nearly ₹16 lakh crore at current prices during 2024–25

items.title: Indian tourists travel closer home as rupee weakness pushes costs
items.summary: Airfares and hotels rates shoot up due to strong demand and limited availability in favourite destinations

items.title: TV prices may rise from January due to memory chips shortage, falling rupee
items.summary: Domestic value addition in an LED TV is around 30% only, and major components like the open cell, semiconductor chips and motherboard, are imported

items.title: India-Russia trade ties: Official says 300 products hold huge potential for Indian exporters
items.summary: At present, India’s exports of these goods to Russia stand at $1.7 billion, as against Russia’s $37.4 billion in imports

items.title: AVNL, MIL drive ₹83,109 cr order book for India’s new defence PSUs
items.summary: The DPSUs are increasingly tapping new domestic and international markets

items.title: Gopalan Aerospace targets ₹130 crore revenue in 2025
items.summary: Local orders now accounting for nearly 60% of its pipeline

items.title: Navi Mumbai Airport Expansion: CIDCO issues tender for third runway study
items.summary: At present, Mumbai and the Mumbai Metropolitan Region (MMR) are primarily served by Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (CSMIA), which has a passenger handling capacity of around 50–55 million passengers per annum (MPPA).

items.title: Nestle India ropes in Nitu Bhushan as new HR Head
items.summary: Her focus areas include business partnering, talent acquisition, gender parity and organizational development,” the company’s BSE filing noted

items.title: Enforcement Directorate aims to end legacy FERA cases by early 2026
items.summary: The criminal sections-loaded FERA of 1973 was replaced in June 2000 by the Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA) of 1999, a civil law

items.title: A takeover in Hollywood that has India's cinema-owners on the edge
items.summary: The $82.7 billion bid by Netflix for Warner Bros has stirred concerns in India's theatrical landscape. While it could boost Netflix's cinema presence, industry experts warn of potential risks to traditional movie theatres and the competitive dynamics of the OTT market.

items.title: Kuwait sees fair oil price at $60-$68 a barrel, says oil minister
items.summary: The recent decline in oil prices was unexpected, Kuwait's Oil Minister Tariq Al-Roumi said on the sidelines of the Organization of Arab Petroleum Exporting Countries' (OAPEC) ministerial meeting in Kuwait.

items.title: PIB Fact Check busts Pak claims of Rafale and S-400 destruction in Op Sindoor; flags fake AI video
items.summary: The fraudulent video implies that Pakistan owns better weapons and equipment and claims that the destruction of Rafale jets and the S-400 missile defence system is evidence of its military superiority over India. It further suggested that India must upgrade its defence equipment.

items.title: NLC India signs a JV with PTC for green energy project
items.summary: The JV between PTC India and NLCIL was set up to establish, operate and maintain renewable energy projects including solar, wind, hydro, battery energy storage systems, green ammonia, and other emerging green technologies

items.title: No scientific link found between COVID-19 vaccination, sudden deaths in young adults: AIIMS study
items.summary: Sudden death in young adults is a significant concern requiring targeted public health strategies, the study said, underlying coronary artery disease remains the leading cause and that respiratory and unexplained deaths warrant further investigation.

items.title: Nearly 50% of Indian family businesses earn $1-30 billion revenue, AI use at 53%: Deloitte
items.summary: Indian family businesses are showing robust growth with many reporting significant annual revenues and double-digit revenue increases. These firms are actively adopting technology, including AI, to manage economic challenges. Expansion plans are underway across various regions. There is also a strong focus on sustainability and governance.

items.title: India's gems, jewellery exports in November grew 20 pc to USD 2.5 bn: GJEPC
items.summary: India's gems and jewellery exports saw a significant jump of 19.64 percent in November, reaching USD 2.5 billion. This growth was driven by strong demand in markets like Hong Kong, China, and the Middle East. Cut and polished diamond exports also increased substantially. Gold studded jewellery shipments surged due to high demand for job works.

items.title: TV prices likely to rise from January as chip crunch and falling rupee squeeze makers
items.summary: Television prices are set to increase by 3 to 4 percent starting next January. This rise is driven by escalating costs of essential memory chips and a weakening Indian Rupee. Major components for LED TVs are imported, making the industry vulnerable to currency fluctuations. Manufacturers are already informing dealers about the impending price adjustments.

items.title: More trouble for Refex Industries as SEBI imposes penalty on CMD for alleged insider trading
items.summary: SEBI alleges unlawful gains of ₹12.33 lakh were made trading Refex Industries’ stock

items.title: Agnelli Family’s Media Firm Should Stay Italian, Minister Says
items.summary: Italy’s foreign minister said the Agnelli family’s Gedi Gruppo Editoriale SpA media company should stay in Italian hands to safeguard press freedom, as sale talks continue with Greece’s Antenna Group.

items.title: Data from more urban, rural markets from 12 big cities to used for new CPI series
items.summary: Data will be from most popular shops for each of the items in various markets

items.title: Centre implements QCOs with relaxations for MSMEs to protect domestic production
items.summary: Minister of State for MSMEs Karandlaje highlighted key relaxations and exemptions for MSMEs, according to a release by the Ministry of Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises

items.title: 50% of Indian family businesses report revenues between $1-30 billion annually: Deloitte
items.summary: Nearly half of Indian family businesses report annual revenues ranging from USD 1 billion to USD 30 billion, with 36 per cent falling within the USD 1-5 billion range, according to a latest report by Deloitte.

items.title: Delhi to run 11 hospitals under PPP model, add over 10,000 beds
items.summary: Delhi government is moving forward with a plan to operate eleven government hospitals through a public-private partnership. Most of these hospitals are currently under construction.

items.title: Benign inflationary trends leave space for RBI’s MPC to cut repo further, economists say
items.summary: Headline inflation appears to have bottomed out in October but is expected to remain well below the RBI’s 4% target for the rest of the year

items.title: ADB approves $240 million loan for Chennai metro expansion in India
items.summary: ADB has approved a USD 240 million loan--the second tranche of the Chennai Metro Rail Investment Project--to support the expansion of the metro rail network and provide cleaner, safer, and more reliable urban transport across the Chennai Metropolitan Area, India.

items.title: 8 of top 10 firms lose Rs 79,129 crore in a weak market; Bajaj Finance emerges top loser
items.summary: Bajaj Finance emerged as the biggest loser among India's most valued companies last week, as its market capitalisation fell sharply by Rs 19,289.7 crore amid a largely bearish trend in the stock market.

items.title: Govt rolls out measures to support MSMEs with regulatory relief and credit access
items.summary: The ‘Levels of Control’ in the Scheme of Inspection and Testing (SIT) are now recommendatory, allowing manufacturers to define their own control unit, batch, or lot. BIS has also made product certification guidelines publicly accessible on its website and is releasing manuals for conformity assessment according to Indian Standards.

items.title: Gems, jewellery exports up 20% on lower base, better realisations
items.summary: Imports of gems and jewellery jump 36% to $1.89 billion

items.title: Banks advised to link MSME loans to external benchmark by RBI: Govt
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India has directed banks to link MSME loans to an external benchmark with a three-month reset clause to improve monetary policy transmission. Existing borrowers can switch to this regime under mutually agreed terms.

items.title: India poised for next phase of multi-trillion-dollar wealth creation: MoSL
items.summary: India is entering a new era of economic growth. The nation's GDP is projected to quadruple by 2042, leading to substantial wealth creation. This expansion will boost consumption and investment across various sectors. Financial services, consumer goods, automobiles, and real estate are expected to see significant opportunities. Rising incomes will drive demand for lifestyle products and services.

items.title: SBI aims to double YONO app users to 20 cr in 2 years, plans significant investment: Chairman
items.summary: State Bank of India is launching YONO 2.0, a new version of its mobile banking app. The bank aims to double its YONO user base to 20 crore customers within the next two years. This upgrade offers enhanced digital experiences and seamless integration across banking channels. SBI also anticipates strong credit growth driven by its RAM segment.

items.title: Navi Mumbai airport: Bids invited for third runway techno-commercial feasibility study consultant
items.summary: CIDCO is seeking a consultant for a techno-commercial feasibility study. This study will assess the viability of a third runway at Navi Mumbai International Airport. The aim is to prepare for future air traffic growth. The consultancy will take six months. This is a crucial step for long-term capacity planning.

items.title: Women lead in financial inclusion with rise in pension scheme subscriptions
items.summary: In FY25, 55% of the total new subscribers to the Atal Pension Yojana were female

items.title: New Year outlook: Brutal conflicts and AI excesses may persist, but let’s hope for a soft landing
items.summary: Brutal conflicts and the AI frenzy look likely to spill into 2026, but thankfully there’s still space to hope for a soft landing. On current indications of geopolitical and economic dynamics, here’s how the New Year will shape up.

items.title: Air India may operate 275 more flights in December as IndiGo faces capacity cut
items.summary: Air India is offering to operate up to 275 additional flights this month to compensate for IndiGo's 10% capacity cut, ordered by the aviation ministry to rebalance routes during peak season. The ministry is reallocating some of IndiGo's routes to Air India, AI Express, and Akasa to prevent passenger suffering and curb IndiGo's market dominance.

items.title: Weaker rupee likely to strengthen headline inflation
items.summary: Economists say imported inflation will play a bigger role in the headline numbers

items.title: Power Ministry lists 16 imported items to achieve self-sufficiency
items.summary: These 16 very critical items include subsea cables, certain permanent magnets, aluminium zinc coated steel sheets, HVDC valve assemblies, modular type ethernet switches and lighting arrester

items.title: Border flare-ups between Thailand and Cambodia seem endless: Can Asean do something?
items.summary: The Asian neighbours have had a border conflict that has lasted for a century. Its origin goes back to colonial tussles but today’s Southeast Asia can’t afford to become a war zone. Asean must step up and resolve this conflict instead of 'managing' it.

items.title: Ficci president: To catapult the economy, we must reform India’s markets for land, power and capital
items.summary: India’s growth numbers are impressive, but to set the stage for long-term prosperity, we need bold factor market reforms. For the competitiveness needed to turn India into a global manufacturing hub, focus on land, power and capital. Here’s what could be done.

items.title: Nestle India appoints former Pernod Ricard HR head Nitu Bhushan as its new HR chief
items.summary: Nestle India is bringing in Nitu Bhushan as its new Head of Human Resources. She joins from Pernod Ricard. The company also announced other leadership transitions. Svetlana Boldina will move to a new role, and Satish Srinivasan will retire. Jagdeep Singh Marahar will take over technical operations. These changes occur as Nestle India faces stiff competition.

items.title: Inflation data, trading activity of foreign investors, global trends to drive markets: Analysts
items.summary: Markets remained volatile and ended the last week in negative territory; Last week, the BSE benchmark index declined by 444.71 points, or 0.51%

items.title: Mint Explainer: Why the RBI is wary of stablecoins—Crypto’s measured wing
items.summary: RBI deputy governor T. Rabi Sankar, speaking at Mint’s Annual BFSI Conclave 2025, has flagged risks associated particularly with stablecoins. Here's why?

items.title: Godrej Properties sells over Rs 2,600-crore homes in 1st year of operation in Hyderabad, looks to expand biz
items.summary: Godrej Properties has achieved significant success in Hyderabad, selling housing properties worth Rs 2,600 crore in its first year. The company is now looking to expand its business in the city due to huge growth opportunities. This strong performance is driving aggressive land acquisition for future projects.

items.title: IFFCO's MD Patel eyes 10% growth in FY26 profit amid nano uptake woes
items.summary: IFFCO Managing Director K J Patel anticipates a 10 percent net profit increase for FY26. The cooperative is focusing on boosting nano fertiliser adoption through extensive farmer training. IFFCO is also expanding its reach internationally with a new plant in Brazil.

items.title: Ad Agency Stocks Seen Turning AI Disruption to Their Advantage
items.summary: A key stock-market theme of 2025 has been the slide in shares that stand to lose out from advances in artificial intelligence, chief among them being advertising agencies.

items.title: ADB approves $240 million loan for Chennai metro expansion in India
items.summary: Beyond infrastructure, the project will enhance inclusive station features, improve travel safety for women and vulnerable users, and support measures to boost non-fare revenues for the long-term financial sustainability of the metro rail system.

items.title: Helios Luxe bets on Tier 2, Tier 3 cities as it launches Swiss watchmaker Auguste Reymond in India
items.summary: In a departure from traditional luxury retail strategy, Helios Luxe is eyeing tier 2 and tier 3 cities as part of its expansion

items.title: Pride Hotels targets IPO by March 2026 to fund renovations
items.summary: The proposed IPO comprises a fresh issue of equity shares worth ₹260 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 3.92 crore equity shares by existing shareholders

items.title: Coca-Cola in talks with TDR Capital to rescue Costa Coffee deal
items.summary: TDR was chosen as Coca-Cola’s preferred bidder, but talks have stalled over the price, with the deal including Coca-Cola retaining a minority stake in the British coffee chain.

items.title: India can emerge as global SAF export hub with low-carbon ethanol advantage: Triveni Engineering CEO
items.summary: India is poised to become a sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) export hub, leveraging its significant ethanol surplus and lower carbon intensity compared to rivals.  With potential SAF plants operational by 2029, India aims to supply Southeast Asia and the Middle East, capitalizing on its competitive advantages in ethanol production.

items.title: India can emerge as global SAF export hub with low-carbon ethanol advantage: Triveni Engineering CEO
items.summary: India can emerge as global SAF export hub with low-carbon ethanol advantage: Triveni Engineering CEO

items.title: ADB approves $108 mn loan to Mizoram to strengthen public healthcare system
items.summary: The Asian Development Bank (ADB) has approved a $108 million results-based loan to support the Government of Mizoram in strengthening its public health care system and achieving universal health coverage.

items.title: CII charts investment roadmap for India’s next decade of growth
items.summary: “The forthcoming Union Budget 2026–27 has to serve the dual role of stabiliser and growth enabler, and promoting investments will be one of the most critical components in this regard,” said the Director General, CII

items.title: Manu Joseph: How ‘The New Yorker,’ a magazine of the elite, managed to survive the age of social media
items.summary: That a proudly elitist magazine has outlived most elite institutions is a paradox of modern media. Online platforms have given everyone an audience. But then, its century-long run of success wasn’t about adapting to change, but satisfying a basic need.

items.title: China Vanke’s Paths to Avoid Default Narrow After Failed Vote
items.summary: China Vanke Co., the nation’s last major developer to have so far avoided default amid an unprecedented property crisis, has been left with little time to keep debt failure at bay after creditors spurned its proposal to push back a looming bond payment.

items.title: CII lays out investment roadmap for Budget 2026-27
items.summary: India's economic future depends on strong investment. The Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) proposes the Union Budget 2026-27 boost public spending and private sector investment. CII suggests tax credits and easier compliance for businesses. They also recommend attracting foreign capital through an NRI Investment Promotion Fund. Simpler borrowing rules and a single-window system for foreign investments are also key.

items.title: US keeps up pressure for GM crops but India holds firm
items.summary: Trump administration views India as a large, critical alternative market to placate ‘MAGA’ farmers

items.title: Arcelor Mittal JV in India to expand nearly 3x by 2030 braving iron ore costs
items.summary: Low steel prices and high iron ore costs have resulted in muted realizations for Indian steelmakers, with margin pressures limiting their ability to fund the aggressive capacity expansion, says AMNS India CEO Dilip Oommen.

items.title: Jaipur discom JVVNL intensifies revenue recovery amid mounting dues
items.summary: Jaipur discom JVVNL is stepping up efforts to recover outstanding dues and combat electricity theft.  The discom has identified high-default areas and is implementing strict measures.  Vigilance operations are also underway to curb power theft. These actions aim to stabilize finances and ensure reliable power supply across Rajasthan.  The discom seeks to send a clear message against non-payment and theft.

items.title: India 'strong champion' of measures against offshore tax evasion: OECD official
items.summary: India is a strong champion of tax transparency, with its recent campaign leading to the disclosure of over Rs 29,000 crore in undisclosed foreign assets. A top OECD official highlighted India's commitment to global tax transparency and automatic exchange of information standards, noting significant outcomes from its NUDGE program.

items.title: Mcap of 8 of top-10 most valued firms erodes by ₹79,129 cr; Bajaj Finance, ICICI Bank hit hard
items.summary: The mcap of Bharti Airtel tanked ₹13,884.63 crore to ₹11,87,948.11 crore and that of State Bank of India diminished by ₹7,846.02 crore to ₹8,88,816.17 crore.

items.title: Last rights: The right to die with dignity should be upheld both in letter and spirit
items.summary: Despite legal recognition of the right to die with dignity and the use of advance medical directives or ‘living wills’ as an enabler, the final phase of life can be traumatic for those on their way out and their loved ones. Respect for an individual’s choice is both humane and just.

items.title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Six months on, college hostel lies in ruins, sans bustle of students
items.summary: Six months after the AI-171 plane crash, the B J Medical College hostel complex in Ahmedabad stands as a haunting reminder. Charred walls and burnt trees replaced student life. Remnants of daily life are scattered across the site. The area remains abandoned and entry is prohibited. Residents near the site still recall the incident with fear.

items.title: Paddy procurement with 60 lakh quintals target to commence from Dec 15 in Jharkhand
items.summary: On December 15, Jharkhand will launch its paddy procurement season, aiming to acquire 60 lakh quintals at a rate of Rs 2,450 per quintal. In a show of support for local farmers, an additional bonus of Rs 81 per quintal will also be provided.

items.title: Ola Electric commences hyperdelivery for its 4680 Bharat Cell powered vehicles
items.summary: Under hyperdelivery initiative, customers can complete their purchase online or at an Ola Electric Store and take home their fully registered vehicles on the same day

items.title: From Europe to India, IATA sounds alarm over rising GPS interference in flights
items.summary: Global airlines are facing a growing concern as GPS spoofing and jamming incidents have risen, demanding increased pilot vigilance. IATA data shows a significant increase in GPS loss rates, with projections indicating a continued upward trend. These interferences, often a byproduct of military activities, are impacting major airports worldwide, including in India.

items.title: Ola Electric commences Hyperdelivery for its 4680 Bharat Cell poweredvehicles
items.summary: This offering is a part of the company's umbrella Hyperservice initiative to deliver a transparent, convenient, and customer-first service experience, the Bengaluru-based firm said in a statement

items.title: BMW to bolster MINI brand; looks to drive in new models, expand sales
items.summary: The automaker imports the MINI range as a completely built-up unit (CBU). Since 2012, the company has sold around 7,500 MINI units in the country

items.title: Nearly 4 GW of solar capacity in Rajasthan hit by transmission constraints
items.summary: About 4,300 MW of solar power capacity in Rajasthan is facing complete daytime curtailment due to a shortage of transmission infrastructure, putting projects worth nearly Rs 20,000 crore at risk, industry sources said.

items.title: NCLAT rejects SEBI’s plea to recover penalty from Annies Apparel
items.summary: NCLAT direction came over an appeal filed by the SEBI, which had moved NCLAT to recover a penalty of ₹21.80 lakh from Annies Apparel, going to liquidation after it failed to attract a buyer during insolvency process.

items.title: Domestic copper industry flags cheap imports, seeks 3% safeguard duty
items.summary: According to IPCPA, a surge in zero-duty copper imports is eroding the country’s domestic smelting and downstream manufacturing sectors, even as over ₹20,000 crore has been invested in recent years to achieve self-sufficiency

items.title: NCLAT rejects SEBI's plea to recover penalty from Annies Apparel
items.summary: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal has rejected SEBI's attempt to recover a penalty from Annies Apparel. The tribunal ruled that claims cannot be filed after a company enters liquidation under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code. This decision upholds the principle that all claims are frozen on the liquidation commencement date.

items.title: BMW to bolster MINI brand; looks to drive in new models, expand sales
items.summary: BMW plans to expand its MINI portfolio in India next year to meet growing demand beyond metro cities. The company will also double its sales network to include smaller towns like Jaipur and Lucknow. This expansion aims to build the MINI community and cater to a broader customer base, with a target of at least double-digit growth for the brand.

items.title: Parliamentary panel recommends easing clearances for underground coal mining projects
items.summary: A parliamentary panel wants simpler rules for underground coal mining.  This method has low environmental impact.  Current complex processes cause project delays.  The government aims for 100 million tonnes of coal from underground mines by 2030.  Simplifying procedures will help achieve this target.  This will also preserve land and forests.  The panel also recommended a single-window clearance for open-cast mining.

items.title: Sakthi Aircraft to start trainer plane manufacturing in Tiruppur in January, easing India’s import reliance
items.summary: It has tied up with Austria’s Diamond Aircraft to support in setting up the plant, which will start manufacturing in January 2026 with deliveries expected in February or March 2026

items.title: Parliamentary Panel urges diversification of crude oil sources to cut geopolitical risks
items.summary: India imports nearly 89 percent of its crude oil. A parliamentary committee highlights this dependence and rising geopolitical risks. It urges the government to diversify oil sources and strengthen risk management. This includes bolstering strategic reserves and developing alternative import routes. Institutionalizing hedging and flexible contracts is also recommended to ensure energy security against future shocks.

items.title: Hong Kong, India fuel blockbuster year for Asia fundraising
items.summary: This year, the Hong Kong market became a beneficiary of China’s artificial-intelligence ambitions, advances in biotechnology, efforts by Beijing to boost domestic demand, and gains in global prices of gold and aluminIum

items.title: Agriculture and national security: India’s first line of defence
items.summary: Strengthening agriculture, therefore, is not just about supporting farmers — it is about safeguarding the nation itself

items.title: Silver may soar further as China curbs exports from January 1
items.summary: Companies in the Communists-ruled nation have to get licences; India imported over 2,600 tonnes of silver in September-October

items.title: Hong Kong, India fuel blockbuster year for Asia fundraising
items.summary: Not long ago, Hong Kong’s share-sale market was a symbol of China’s slowdown: Deal books were thin, investor sentiment was sour and bankers were fleeing the industry. This year, the script has flipped.

items.title: JioHotstar loads up on South originals as post-merger viewership explodes
items.summary: JioHotstar is significantly boosting its South India presence with a Rs 4,000 crore investment over five years, commissioning 25 new regional titles. The platform aims to build viewing habits through long-running episodic shows and by doubling down on reality content, following strong post-merger momentum and consumer response.

items.title: SpaceX is worth $800 billion, report says. This is only the beginning.
items.summary: A secondary offering of SpaceX stock, offering liquidity to insiders, valued the rocket company at $800 billion, according to Bloomberg.

items.title: Food Fighters: The voices urging India to look closer at what’s on its plate
items.summary: Meet  food activists who are spearheading the battle to bring clarity and awareness to what India consumes— from Dr Sivaranjani Santosh who has campaigned against the mislabelling of ORS, to Dr Arun Gupta who is calling for front-of-pack labels, to Revant Himatsingka who is exhorting people to check ingredients

items.title: Netflix vs Paramount: The high-stakes battle for Warner Bros, explained in 5 charts
items.summary: The fight between Netflix and Paramount Skydance to acquire Warner Bros could reshape both the streaming market and theatrical distribution—and it's turning political.

items.title: India, Georgia review bilateral relations at 8th Foreign Office Consultations
items.summary: India and Georgia held their 8th Foreign Office Consultations in Tbilisi. Discussions focused on strengthening bilateral ties across political, economic, and cultural spheres. Both nations reviewed regional and global issues. This meeting aims to deepen the strategic relationship. Historical and cultural links between the two countries were also highlighted.

items.title: India–Mexico FTA talks begin amid looming tariff hikes
items.summary: India and Mexico are discussing a free trade agreement. This comes as Mexico plans to impose new tariffs on imports from non-preferential partners like India. The terms of reference for the pact are expected soon. Both nations aim for mutually beneficial solutions. This move could strengthen bilateral trade ties and address concerns over rising duties.

items.title: CBDT flags bogus claims on political and charitable donations
items.summary: The Central Board of Direct Taxes has uncovered significant misuse of tax deductions for political and charitable donations. A campaign has begun, urging taxpayers to review and correct their income tax returns. The department is taking action against intermediaries involved in issuing bogus receipts. Taxpayers are encouraged to voluntarily update their returns to avoid penalties.

items.title: Amid fading FAME surge, charging woes, GST 2.0 ICE kickstart, electric 2-wheelers need new direction
items.summary: Legacy manufacturers continue to anchor the market. Hero MotoCorp retained its leadership, followed by Honda and TVS, signalling a return to steady demand for petrol models even as the festive surge tapered off. The resurgence underscores the surprising reality that while EVs were expected to disrupt ICE dominance by now, it is the ICE market that appears far more predictable and resilient, experts said.

items.title: IndiGo: Turbulent skies
items.summary: The airline, which commands a 65% share of India’s domestic aviation market, says operations are stabilising after days of chaos that saw hundreds of flight cancellations

items.title: Three US lawmakers introduce resolution to end India tariffs
items.summary: Three US lawmakers have introduced a resolution in Congress. They aim to end tariffs imposed by the Trump administration on India. The lawmakers believe this tariff strategy is counterproductive. It weakens a critical partnership between the two nations. The resolution seeks to terminate the national emergency that authorized these tariffs.

items.title: Higher Edu Reforms: New bill welcome, actions must align
items.summary: India is set to introduce the Vikasit Bharat Vidya Adhikshan Bill, 2025. This new law will reshape higher education regulation. The goal is to move away from outdated, control-focused rules. The focus will shift to academic quality and real outcomes. This reform aims to foster innovation and improve standards across institutions.

items.title: We want BRIDGE to be the Davos for media: DG of UAE  Media Office
items.summary: Held by the private BRIDGE Alliance, but under the aegis of the Government of the UAE, the three-day summit brought together voices from journalism, cinema, music, technology and communications to deliberate on issues ranging from misinformation and trust deficits to the growing influence of artificial intelligence on global media ecosystems

items.title: After fake ID crackdown, IRCTC daily new accounts down to 5000 from one lakh: Railways
items.summary: Indian Railways has successfully reduced new user IDs on the IRCTC website. A new system verifies user identities, leading to a drop from nearly one lakh to about 5,000 new IDs daily. This crackdown has deactivated over 3 crore fake accounts. Another 2.7 crore are suspended or flagged for suspicious activity.

items.title: 90% of IndiGo's flight operations have returned to normal: Union minister Murlidhar Mohol
items.summary: IndiGo's flight operations are nearly back to normal. Union Minister Murlidhar Mohol stated that about 90 percent of flights have resumed. The airline faced cancellations due to new safety rules. A committee will be formed to assign responsibility for the disruptions. Passengers experienced losses.

These reforms consolidate existing laws, strengthen maternity benefits, expand social security to gig workers, and allow women to work in previously restricted sectors, fostering greater economic independence and career advancement.

Food prices declined for the sixth consecutive month.

items.title: Why are all eyes now watching your shopping cart?
items.summary: India's economic growth is increasingly driven by robust domestic consumption, a crucial buffer against global trade headwinds and rising tariffs. Low inflation, coupled with GST cuts and easing income taxes, is boosting household purchasing power. A significant revival in rural demand further strengthens this internal economic resilience, positioning consumer spending as India's most reliable growth pillar amidst global uncertainties.

items.title: Renewable energy capacity addition surges in April-November

items.title: Watch: Indian rice exporters not worried about US’s high tariff threats
